Welcome to the MICA lab pipeline¬∂

Getting started¬∂

One key goal of the MICAPIPE is to harmonize analytical methods both within and across ENIGMA Working Groups, ultimately facilitating comparisons of imaging and genetic findings across diseases.


Main workflow ‚öôÔ∏è¬∂

Tired of displaying your surface findings in tables? Look no further! The MICAPIPE has got you covered! Check out our visualization tools and project your cortical and subcortical data to the surface!


Processing steps üë£¬∂

Tired of displaying your surface findings in tables? Look no further! The MICAPIPE has got you covered! Check out our visualization tools and project your cortical and subcortical data to the surface!


Quality Check¬∂

The MICAPIPE has a No data, No problem policy! To make things easier, we provide from an individual site that have been processed according to ENIGMA protocols. Using our example data, previously published summary statistics, or any other ENIGMA-derived datasets, you can easily complete all of the tutorials!


Additional tools¬∂


Development and getting involved ‚öôÔ∏è¬∂

Should you have any problems, questions, or suggestions about the MICAPIPE, please do not hesitate to post them to our Github issues! Or are you interested in collaborating or sharing your codes/tools? Noice! Make sure you familiarize yourself with our contributing guidelines first and then discuss your ideas on our Github issues and pull request.
